STATE OF MICHIGAN
DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
GRETCHEN WHITMER ROBERT GORDON
LANSING
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
November 5, 2020
Peter Holt
Kalamazoo County Family Court
1536 Gull Rd
Kalamazoo, MI 49048
RE: License #: CO390201216
Investigation #: 2021C0214003
Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home
Dear Mr. Holt:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to
the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Claudia Triestram, the area manager at (616) 552-3662.
01/2015 P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909-8150
www.michigan.gov  (517) 284-9740

Sincerely,
Paul Fatato, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
322 E. Stockbridge Ave
Kalamazoo, MI 49001
(269) 251-2471
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF LICENSING AND REGULATORY AFFAIRS
BUREAU OF COMMUNITY AND HEALTH SYSTEMS
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CO390201216
Investigation #: 2021C0214003
Complaint Receipt Date: 10/15/2020
Investigation Initiation Date: 10/16/2020
Report Due Date: 12/14/2020
Licensee Name: Kalamazoo County Family Court
Licensee Address: 1536 Gull Rd
Kalamazoo, MI 49048
Licensee Telephone #: Unknown
Administrator: Thomas Canny, Designee
Licensee Designee: Thomas Canny, Designee
Name of Facility: Kalamazoo County Juvenile Home
Facility Address: 1424 Gull Road
Kalamazoo, MI 49048
Facility Telephone #: (269) 385-8550
Original Issuance Date: 05/01/1992
License Status: INSPECTED
Effective Date: 04/29/2019
Expiration Date: 04/28/2021
Capacity: 40
Program Type: COURT OPERATED RESIDENTIAL CARE
FACILITY

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
Staff member entered resident's room and placed one hand Yes
around resident's neck and the other hand on his groin area, held
for 5 seconds, then left. Resident could not breathe while being
choked.
Additional Findings Yes
III. METHODOLOGY
10/15/2020 Special Investigation Intake
2021C0214003
10/16/2020 Special Investigation Initiated – Telephone interview with
Administrator 1 and Complainant.
10/16/2020 Contact - Document Received: personnel records for Staff 1,
written statements and PREA review.
10/19/2020 Contact - Face to Face interviews with Resident A, Resident B,
Resident C, Staff 1, and Staff 2.
10/19/2020 Contact - Document Received – policy/procedure.
11/02/2020 Contact - Document Received – policy/procedure.
11/04/2020 Inspection Completed-BCAL Sub. Compliance
ALLEGATION:
Staff member entered resident's room and placed one hand around resident's neck
and the other hand on his groin area, held for 5 seconds, then left. Resident could
not breathe while being choked.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed Administrator 1 by phone on 10/16/20. He reports being aware of
the allegations and having put a safety plan in place that restricts Staff 1 from any
contact with Resident A. He also reports that Resident A is in isolation as any new
resident would be, because of the COVID restrictions. He reported that there is a
video of the area, but it does not show what occurred in the room. He also reports

that he will provide a copy of the video for viewing. He ended by reporting that a
PREA investigation is ongoing as a result of the allegations.
I interviewed the Complainant by phone on 10/16/20. He reports being told by
Resident B that Staff 1 had assaulted Resident A. He also reported that Resident B
told him, “I saw a lot of movement in the room and heard Resident A say don’t touch
me”. The Complainant reported speaking with Resident A and Resident A reported
that he had told Resident B he was assaulted by Staff 1. Resident A is also reported
to have told the Complainant that “he was scared to say anything”. The Complainant
reports being told by Resident A that “Staff 1 thought I called him a bitch and he
came into my room. Staff 1 grabbed me around my neck and with his other hand he
grabbed my groin area.” The Complainant also reported that Resident A informed
him this interaction with Staff 1 grabbing him lasted about “five seconds”. The
Complainant reports that Resident A also provided a written statement of the event.
The Complainant who is also the PREA Coordinator for the facility, reports
completing an investigation which involved speaking to the two residents who
reported being witness to the event. He reports being told by Resident B that he
observed Staff 1 in Resident A’s room and heard screaming with a lot of movement.
The Complainant reported that Resident C informed him that he was unable to see
anything but did hear “a lot of screaming and commotion”. The Complainant reported
that all three-residents provided written statements of the event. He reports speaking
to Staff 1 who reports going back into Resident A’s room following the events
outlined in the allegations. Staff 1 is reported to have told the Complainant that he
“lectured Resident A about his behaviors but made no threats” and this was
confirmed by Resident A. He also reported that Staff 1 admitted that he should have
taken Resident A out of his room to speak to him.
I interviewed Resident A in collaboration with the DHHS Specialist at the
facility on 10/19/20. He reports remembering the incident and stated, “I was in my
room talking to a friend when Staff 1 came into my room and putting my mat up on
the window in the door. He said I called him a bitch.” He reports sitting on the sink
before being grabbed by the neck and choked by Staff 1. He stated, “he just touched
my penis and used his other hand to choke my neck. He squeezed a little bit and it
lasted about ten seconds.” Resident A reported that if he reported Staff 1’s actions,
“something really bad would happen”. He also reported that Staff 1 said, “you’re a
kid and don’t disrespect a grown man like me and don’t tell that I touched your
private part”. Resident A reported that his neck hurt and that he was observed by the
nurse the next day. He ended by reporting that he felt safe as long as he did not
have Staff 1 working near him.
I interviewed Staff 1 in collaboration with the DHHS Specialist at the facility on
10/19/20. He reports remembering the incident last week. He also reports that it took
place just before shift change and that he was working a different pod. He reports
overhearing on the monitoring system, “a lot of swearing and banging coming from
the pod that Resident A was lodged on”. He also reports being able to listen in to
each individual room and hear a lot of swearing from the room Resident A was lodge

in. He reports walking onto the pod and asked the entire population who was
swearing. He also reports getting no response, so he went to Resident A’s room. He
reports putting up the mat in the window of the door before entering the room to
“speak to Resident A about respect”. He reports leaving the room and going into the
control room to listen to the Pod for noise again. He also reports hearing Resident A
swear again so he went back into his room. He reports that when he entered the
room again, Resident A was “standing on the sink so he could see above the mat
covering part of the window in the door”. He reports that the first time he went into
the room, Resident B and Staff 2 were standing in the common area and had a
limited view inside Resident A’s room. Staff 1 denied touching Resident A at any
time he went into the room He also denied saying that something bad would happen
to Resident A if he said something. Staff 1 did admit that he was yelling at Resident
A. He reported having no contact with Resident A since the incident.
I interviewed Resident B in collaboration with the DHHS Specialist at the
facility on 10/19/20. He reports remembering the incident and being witness to
some of it. He also reports that Resident A called someone a name which resulted in
Staff 1 putting a “curtain” up over his window in his door. He stated, “Staff 1 went
into Resident A’s room and Resident A started screaming”. Resident B reported that
he was standing next to Staff 2 in the common area and had a partial view into the
bedroom of Resident A. He also stated, “I saw a hand on Resident A’s neck before
Staff 1 moved him out of the way”. He denied observing Staff 1 touch Resident A in
the groin area. He did report that he started laughing when it first occurred but
stopped when Resident A started screaming. Resident B reported talking with
Resident A the next day and having Resident A tell him about the choking and
pushing, “but he never said anything about Staff 1 touching his penis”. Resident B
reports talking to Supervisor 1 (PREA Coordinator) about the allegations. Resident B
reported that he doesn’t feel safe because “they can come into my room because
they have a key”. He also reports telling his mother about the allegations and how
unsafe he feels. He stated, “I hope they can get me out of here because I am not
safe”. He ended by reporting that “Staff 1 has a bad temper and overreacts”.
I interviewed Resident C in collaboration with the DHHS Specialist at the
facility on 10/19/20. He reports remembering the incident and being present when it
occurred. He also reports that he observed Staff 1 put the curtain on the door
window to Resident A’s room. He reported observing Staff 1 go into Resident A’s
room and then hearing Resident A yelling and screaming “don’t put hands on me”.
He also reported that Resident A yelled, “you’re not my mom or dad so don’t put
your hands on me”. He reported that Staff 1 was in the room for twenty seconds. He
also reported that Resident A was doing “a lot of swearing and he did call Staff 1 a
bitch”. Resident C reported having a belief that Staff 1 and Resident A don’t like
each other but he was unable to provide evidence of this other than the incident. He
reported having contact with Staff 1 “on the outs” and that Staff 1 made fun of him in
front of other residents during a past stay at the facility. He also reports that he
doesn’t feel safe with Staff 1 working at the facility but also reported that Staff 1 is
“cool on the outs”.

I interviewed Staff 2 in collaboration with the DHHS Specialist at the facility on
10/19/20. He reports being present during the allegations. He stated, “I was getting
Resident B out of his room and standing in the common area when Staff 1 came
onto the Pod. He went to Resident A’s room, put up the curtain and walked into the
room”. Staff 2 reports hearing Staff 1 say “get down off there” and that Staff 1
appeared to be “scolding Resident A”. Staff 2 also reported that in the past, the
facility had a resident who was standing on the sink and fell, getting hurt, so staff
want residents to stay off the sink. Staff 2 reported that Staff 1 was showing
frustration and should have had another staff observe him when he went into the
bedroom. He also reported having a limited view of the room, especially when Staff
1 and Resident A moved from the doorway. He did report observing “Resident A
moving towards Staff 1 with his fists balled up”. He also reported observing Staff 1
pointing his finger towards Resident A but that he never observed Staff 1 touch
Resident A. Staff 2 reports being witness to phone calls that Resident B made to his
mother later that evening. He reports that Resident B informed his mother that
Resident A was roughed up and that he hoped this situation might get him out of the
facility sooner. He ended by reporting that “the allegations don’t sound like anything
Staff 1 would do because he is very helpful to the kids here”. Staff 2 did report that
staff are to have another staff present if they are going into a resident’s room for
safety of the resident and staff.
Documents reviewed:
I reviewed the personnel file of Staff 1. The following information was documented in
the personnel file.
 10/13/2009 a report was written in which it was stated, “your use of profanity
and telling the residents not to bother filing grievances as they do no good
and do not ‘go anywhere’.” This document was stated to have as
documentation of the discussion with Staff 1 and the Chief Administrator.
 Documentation of a written reprimand for leaving the building without
appropriate notification took place on 12/15/2009. This document also states
that Staff 1 brought privileges in the form of food to residents which is not
allowed without the resident paying for the items as stated by the facility
policy/procedures.
 Another document dated 4/2/2010 involved a written warning for mixing
populations at the facility. This was citied under the “Shared space day room”
procedure.
 On 5/19/2010 it is documented that Staff 1 received a “second written
warning” for acting as an inappropriate role model. Documentation indicates
that Staff 1 allowed residents to engage in “gambling” which is a violation of
the rules for the residents in the facility. The gambling was identified as Staff
1 betting with a resident on a basketball game.

 Another document of disciplinary action took place on 3/10/2015 when it was
documented that Staff 1 was using his cell phone in front of residents during
working hours.
 On 1/30/18 there is documentation that a written warning was issued to Staff
1 after it was found that he referred to a female resident as “thirsty”. As part of
the corrective action plan, Staff 1 was to review the video on the training
regarding harassment for employees. It was documented that this was
completed on 2/5/18.
 On 6/27/18 it was documented that a “counseling memo” was provided to
Staff 1 regarding seven unscheduled sick occurrences. This is in violation of
the facility policy/procedure for the use of sick occurrences.
 Documentation indicates that on 3/27/2020 a counseling memo was issued to
Staff 1 for “professionalism around residents and staff”. There is
documentation that Staff 1 was “calling residents names, “Bum”, and
provoking residents. Staff 1 is documented as “refused to sign” this
document.
 On 9/1/2020 a document indicates that Staff 1 received a counseling memo
for missing a “mandatory staff meeting & PREA training on 8/31/2020.
I reviewed the “Incident Report dated 10/14/2020 involving the allegations signed by
Staff 1. The incident is described:
During staff on first shift around 2:15 after residents were placed in their room on
B-1 side I. Staff 1 heard lots of yelling and profanity on the B-2 side. I was in the
middle in the shared space area when I cut the mike on. Heard B-2 side room
112 (Resident A) using profanity I went over and talked with the resident and told
them to stop yelling and using profanity and then I walked back to the other side.
After telling them to stop after I got back to the middle the mic was still on and he
was still using profanity saying staff was all bitches. I told all the resident the day
before that if they were yelling, I was going to put up their curtain they all said ok.
After I put up his curtain and went to talk with him about his profanity he was up
on the desk. I told him to get down and told him the story about the resident and I
told him that I would let his curtain down if he would follow the rule. Didn’t touch
the kid at all.
The resident version on this incident report had the following documentation: “Staff 1
grabbed my neck and genitals”.
Disciplinary Action Authorized: “Staff 1 removed from resident area pending
investigation”.
I reviewed the “Incident Report dated 10/14/2020 involving the allegations signed by
Staff 2. The incident is described:

I was getting Resident B up for his court hearing. I was heading to the door to the
courtyard when I saw Staff 1 enter the pod and approach room B112. Staff 1 put
up his curtain and opened his door. I stayed on the side so that there was
someone observing staff as they entered a kid’s room. I did witness Staff 1
pointing his finger stride up to Resident A and holler to the resident to stop yelling
and cursing. He also yelled at Resident A to get down from his sink, which
Resident A did, or he could end up like another resident that fell and broke his
tooth. Staff 1 also start walking to leave the room when he told Resident A that
he heard him yelling his name about something and told him to stop yelling his
name while in his room. I did not observe Staff 1 put his hands-on Resident A in
any way. I, however, did see Resident A with hands balled up, walk up to Staff 1,
and stand next to him while Staff 1 was by the doorway before exited his room.
The resident version on this incident report had the following documentation:
“Accused Staff 1 of assaulting him”.
I reviewed the written statement by Resident A dated 10/14/2020. The statement
provided the following documentation:
So I was talking to (unknown resident) and Staff 1 said I was yelling and put my
mat up and I don’t know what I said. He came back and said what did you say, I
said I didn’t say anything, and he choked me and grabbed by private part. And
said if I told anybody something would happen.
I reviewed the written statement by Resident B dated 10/14/2020. The statement
provided the following documentation:
This happened at about 2:30. I was just getting out of my room for court.
Resident A had said something to Staff 1 and he had put his mat up on his door.
Then Resident A had (unable to read this section) then Staff 1 had opened his
door and then he was screaming, and Resident A door was open then me and
Staff 2 and everybody was looking. Then Resident A was screaming loud now he
was looking, and I see Resident A getting tossed around like a ball and
everybody was looking.
I reviewed the written statement by Resident C dated 10/14/2020. The statement
provided the following documentation:
So I was in my room and I heard B112 saying don’t put your hand on me, so I get
up to see what going on and I see Staff 1 go in there.
I reviewed the nursing email dated 10/15/20. This document stated the following:
Yesterday (10-14-20) I was asked to check on Resident A. This was after the
doctor and I saw him around 10:30 AM at which time he did not discuss any
problems or injuries. When I checked on him in the afternoon he said “my neck is

sore, someone choked me yesterday” I could see no visible redness, swelling or
bruising on his neck or head. He denied any other injuries. I have documented
this in his medical chart in my office. I did not go into details of the incident with
him other than his reported injury/pain. Supervisors were already aware of the
incident as one of them asked me to assess this injury.
I reviewed the facility policy “2.17 personnel standards of conduct”. Item five reads:
Developing relationships with juveniles other than what is necessary in the
normal conduct of the facility, staff shall not use their position to become
emotionally, physically and/or romantically involved with juveniles.
I reviewed the facility policy “2.17a Professional Boundaries: Employee Relationship
with Residents and their Family Members”. Item B states:
Establishing inappropriate boundaries with residents wherein the boundaries of a
staff/resident relationship are blurred (i.e., developing friendships with residents
and/or their families, keeping secrets with residents and/or their families, etc.).
Attempting to impose personal values (i.e., religion, issues of morality) on
residents.
I reviewed the facility policy “4.7 Rules and Discipline Resident Management. States:
Item 3.J: Examples of staff failure to comply with the policy shall include, but not
be limited to: Shouting and screaming at residents.
4.D: Serve as models for resident behavior.
4.D: Examples of successful compliance with their policy shall include:
Reacting to a resident’s inappropriate behavior in a calm emotionally neutral
manner
I reviewed the facility policy “4.8 Rules and Discipline Resident Rights. States:
5.J: Examples of failure to comply with (follow) the policy shall include, but not be
limited to: J. Shouting or screaming at residents.
F.5: Shall contribute individually to maintaining a therapeutic environment.
Reacting to a resident’s inappropriate behavior in a calm emotionally neutral
manner
I reviewed the facility policy “5.6 Safety and Security - Security Checks/Supervision”.
States:
Item B.3: The shift supervisor should be made aware if assistance is needed
when conducting visual checks.
Note: Visual checks are done to ensure the safety of the resident and security of
the building. It is required that you visually confirm the presence and safety of the

resident. This may require opening the resident’s room door to verify their
presence.
I reviewed the video recording provided by the facility of the area outside of Resident
A’s room and on the day the allegations took place. A review of the video recording
is as follows:
 2:14:57.403 PM 10/13/20 Video begins. The view is from the southeast
corner of the common area. Resident A’s room is straight ahead and in the
southwest corner of the room.
 2:15:09.517 PM Resident A can be seen through the window of his door
moving up and down. Two other residents to the left of Resident A’s room and
three and four doors down can also be seen standing near their door and
through the window.
 2:15:41.747 Resident A again appears in the window of his door as Staff 1
comes into the common area from the right of the viewing area. Staff 1 is
observed walking towards Resident A’s room.
 2:15:49.653 Staff 1 reaches the door to Resident A’s room while Resident A
remains visible through the window of his door.
 2:15:52.657 Staff 1 places a white covering over the window of the door of
Resident A’s room.
 2:15:55.860 Staff 1 leaves and begins walking back the way he came.
 2:16:04.667 Staff 1 goes back through the door to the right of the viewing
area that he entered the area.
 2:16:45.107 Staff 2 enters the common area through the door below the
camera.
 2:16:49.613 Staff 2 walks to Resident B’s door and begins to unlock the door.
 2:16:52.717 Resident B comes out of his room as Staff 1 reenters the
common area through the door to the right that he exited the room.
 2:17:00.423 Staff 2 and Resident B reach the door that Staff 2 entered the
room from. Staff 1 reaches Resident A’s door and begins unlocking the door.
 2:17:03.327 Staff 2 walks over to Resident C’s door and appears to engage in
conversation. Resident B remains near the door and Staff 1 enters Resident
A’s room.
 2:17:11.333 Staff 2 has walked back to the exit door and both he and
Resident B turn towards Resident A’s room. The door to Resident A’s room is
halfway open but there is no view of either Staff 1 or Resident A from the
camera view.
 2:17:17.237 Resident B turns back towards Staff 2 who is viewing papers in
his hand. Staff 1 and Resident A remain hidden behind the half-opened room
door.

 2:17:18.640 Resident B turns back towards Resident A’s room and Staff 2
looks towards the room.
 2:17:20.843 Resident B turns back around and engages in conversation with
Staff 2.
 2:17:26.247 Staff 1 backs out of Resident A’s room and Resident B turns
towards the room. Staff 2 is facing Resident A’s room.
 2:17:30.050 Staff 1 is standing in the doorway of Resident A’s room and
Resident A can be seen standing in the room. Resident B and Staff 2 are
facing the exit door.
 2:17:32.753 Staff 1 steps back into Resident A’s room, blocking any view of
Resident A. Resident B and Staff 2 both turn and look towards Resident A’s
room.
 2:17:42.363 Staff 1 steps out and turns away from Resident A’s room.
Resident B and Staff 2 begin to go through the exit door.
 2:17:53.373 Resident B and Staff 2 have left the area as Staff 1 reaches the
door he has entered and exited the common area from.
 2:22:58.167 Staff 1 comes back into the common area. He walks into the area
stopping at the second and third doors on the west side of the room. It
appears he is communicating with the residents in the two rooms.
 2:23:13.380 Staff 1 reaches Resident A’s door and begins to unlock the door.
 2:23:18.487 Staff 1 goes into Resident A’s room and shuts the door behind
him.
 2:26:18.263 The door to Resident A’s room opens a few inches but no one is
seen.
 2:29:53.867 Staff 1 comes out of Resident A’s room but appears to be in
conversation with Resident A who is unseen.
 2:30:03.377 Staff 1 shuts the door and removes the item blocking the window
of the door to Resident A’s room.
 2:30:10.983 Resident A can be seen looking out of the window to his door.
Staff 1 walks across the room towards the door he entered the room from.
 2:30:20.490 Staff 1 stops outside of a room to speak to a resident in the
room.
 2:30:32.003 Staff 1 goes through the door he entered the room from.
 2:30:37.010 Staff 1 turns from the door and reenters the room to straighten up
a chair near the middle of the room.
 2:30:54.3278 Staff 1 leaves the room.
 2:30:59.930 Video recording ends.

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.10169 Discipline.
A facility shall have and follow written policy and procedure
which stipulates that residents shall not be subjected to any of
the following:
Humiliation.
ANALYSIS: Evidence provided through interviews, written documentation
and a video recording does not support the allegations of Staff 1
physically abusing Resident A. The video recording does not
provide evidence either way because there is no clear view of
the interaction between Staff 1 and Resident A in his room. The
two witnesses that had somewhat of a view of the room only
had a narrow view into the room and were very limited in what
they would have been able to view. However, given the verbal
reports and written statements, there is evidence to support that
Staff 1 did not provided the type of behavior management that is
required by the facility. His self-report of yelling and lecturing
Resident A goes against the facility policy/procedures in regard
to behavior management for residents.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ADDITIONAL FINDINGS:
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.10103 Program statement.
Written policies and procedures pertaining to the admission,
care, and release of residents.

ANALYSIS: Evidence provided through interviews, written documentation,
and a video recording support the allegation that Staff 1 did not
follow the policy/procedure for supervision of Resident A. He
went into Resident A’s room with the door shut for
approximately three minutes. Staff 1 opened the door a couple
of inches and was not seen for an additional three and a half
minutes. This action is not what is required in the
policy/procedure for Security checks/Supervision. The other
evidence of Staff 1 not following the policy/procedures of the
facility occurred when he failed to serve as a positive role model
when he was yelling and lecturing Resident A.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
With an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that no change be
made to the license of this Court Operated Facility.
11/4/2020
________________________________________
Paul Fatato Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
November 5, 2020

Claudia Triestram Date
Area Manager
